ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Getting really Annoyed
ygData.msgSnippet: Have to disagree, vehemently.  Corpse and Item poofing bugs are incredibly rare.  I know well over 100 players and none of them have ever encountered even a
ygData.messageBody:
Have to disagree, vehemently. Corpse and Item poofing bugs are incredibly
rare. I know well over 100 players and none of them have ever encountered
even a single one. Item duping bugs are more easily solved by banning the
dupers, otherwise they will just find another way. Bugs to a song that
every bard over a certain level would use every single day if it were fixed
are far more important. Nut again it shows Verant's bias, which apparently
you buy into. Pleasing the small percentage of 8+ hour a day players is
more important than pleasing the vast majority who play 2 hours a day or
less.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@...]
Sent: Wednesday, August 23, 2000 4:49 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Getting really Annoyed


Ok this REALLY falls into the "whiney player" category. If I'd known this
was what you were posting about earlier I wouldn't have replied to your
message at all on whineplay.

Sorry my friend but Duping bugs, corpse loss bugs, item poofing bugs etc
take FAR more priority, to me, than fixing a song that I have learned to do
without. I'd FAR rather not be able to mez than to lose all my hard earned
items to a corpse poofing bug.

Complaining about reality is one thing but they HAVE had some pretty major
bugs pop up over the past couple weeks that really do take priority over
fixing things like a secondary resist on our songs. I'm not saying our
songs aren't important to me, far from it, but I really think we need to
keep things in perspective.

Lyrnia Jongleur
Bard of Norrath since Beta 2
----- Original Message -----
From: "Stephen E. McCloskey" <s.mccloskey@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, August 23, 2000 2:27 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Getting really Annoyed

>

> things pop up over the past few weeks that have taken priority. Regarding

> necessarily supposed to affect it, however upon looking into it we've
> determined that the way it works now is sufficient for the spell.
>
>
